summary:
Lymphoma is a type of cancer that starts in white blood cells called lymphocytes. It can cause swollen lymph nodes, fever, night sweats, and weight loss. There are two main types: Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

Doctors aren't always sure what causes it, but some risks include viruses, family history, and a weak immune system. Diagnosis involves tests and scans. Treatment may include chemotherapy, radiation, or medicine.

Lymphoma is a common cancer, affecting thousands worldwide. Many people can be cured, especially with Hodgkin lymphoma.
title: Lymphoma
